decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed development, by reason of its excessive size, bulk and limited set back from the boundaries of the host building, would be visually obtrusive and incongruous within its context, to the detriment of the visual amenities of the neighbouring residents and the character of the area, contrary to Policy D3 (7) of the London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies (2013) and would not be within the tolerances Condition A.2(1)(e) Class A, Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the General Permitted Development Order (2015) as amended.

Reason : 2 - The proposed extensions would adversely impact upon the amenity of the neighbouring occupiers at Nos 1 and 2 Hillingdon Court, in terms of overbearing and overlooking impacts. The development would therefore would fail to comply with the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Policy D3 (D7) of The London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010) and would not be within the tolerances Condition A.2(1)(g) Class A, Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the General Permitted Development Order (2015) as amended.

Reason : 3 - The proposal does not make adequate provision for parking within the curtilage of the property and given the present highway and traffic conditions in this road, is likely to have an adverse effect on highway safety and movement, contrary to  Policies T3, T4, T6 of the London Plan (2021) and DM42 of Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013).
description: Additional two Storeys (height 5.8 m) of development containing 6. flats on a detached commercial or mixed use building - maximum overall height 17.1 m (Prior approval of  transport and highways impacts; air traffic and defence asset impacts; contamination risks; flooding risks; the external appearance of the building; fire escape; waste storage; the provision of adequate natural light in all habitable rooms of the new dwellinghouses; impact on the amenity of the existing building and neighbouring premises;  impacts of noise from any commercial premises on the intended occupiers of the new dwellinghouses;  impacts of the introduction of, or an increase in, a residential use of premises in the area on the carrying on of any trade, business or other use of land in the area and impact on a protected view)
